Package infodynamics.utils

Class NeighbourNodeData

    Class for storing nearest neighbour values during the search
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeighbourNodeData

        public NeighbourNodeData​(int sampleIndex,
                         double[] norms,
                         double distance)
        Create an instance representing data about one given nearest neighbour to another data point.
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - index of the neighbour
        norms - norms between the neighbour and the other data point, for each high-level variable.
        distance - the max of the norms (used for sorting NeighbourNodeData objects in a PriorityQueue)

    • Method Detail

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(NeighbourNodeData other)
        Override's Comparable.compareTo(Object) to provide a natural comparison for the NeighbourNodeData class, based on the underlying distance member.

        IMPORTANT -- we reverse the usual comparison return values, returning a positive number if other is greater, and a negative number if other is less. This is so that a PriorityQueue of NeighbourNodeData objects will hold that with the largest distance as the head (whereas for standard return values from this method it would be the other way around).

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<NeighbourNodeData>
        Parameters:
        other - Other NeighbourNodeData to compare to
